structure.unit: OFFENSES AGAINST THE STATE AND PUBLIC JUSTICE

law.catch_line: Forging names on petition, memorial, remonstrance.
law.text: Any person who signs any name to a petition, memorial or remonstrance intended for presentation to the General Assembly, a county judge/executive or the Governor, without authority from the person whose name is signed or where there is no such person, shall be fined not less than fifty dollars ($50) nor more than five hundred dollars ($500).
law.history: Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 384, sec. 531, effective June 17, 1978. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1345.
